messages.content:
Can you help me make this email friendly and a bit easier to understand. i'm trying to ask if they will pay for my flight without being pushy:
"""Salam Paola and Alejandra!
I am getting more and more excited for our time together and was sad to miss our last session as I was flying over to the US to meet my family for the Eid Celebration. 
Last week I sent in my bank information for the accomodation grant, and today I was intending to get my flight - although Nilam suggested I check to see if the travel agency had reached out to me to coordinate, I am not sure the name of the agency to search my emails or if the flight is something I should do my self. Please let me know, thank you :)
I believe our last meeting was recorded and uploaded here I will watch and catch up with any other updates. See you soon on the call with Dr. Vago, insha'allah and I hope you're having a great start to your week."""

Sure! Here's a friendlier and clearer version of your email that gently asks about the flight without sounding pushy:

---

**Subject:** Quick Check-In About Travel Plans ✈️

**Salam dear Paola and Alejandra,**

I hope you're both having a wonderful start to your week! I'm getting more and more excited about our upcoming time together. I was sad to miss the last session—I was flying to the US to be with my family for Eid celebrations.

Last week, I sent in my bank information for the accommodation grant. I was planning to book my flight today, but Nilam mentioned that a travel agency might be coordinating the arrangements. I haven’t seen anything in my inbox, and I’m not sure of the agency's name—should I wait for them to reach out, or should I go ahead and book the ticket myself?

Please let me know what you recommend—thank you so much!

I believe our last meeting was recorded, so I’ll watch the recording and catch up. Looking forward to seeing you soon on the call with Dr. Vago, insha’Allah.

Warmly,  
Bilal

---

Let me know if you'd like to make it more formal, casual, or add anything personal!
